qas.question: How much of Nigeria has HIV as of 2012?
How much of the Nigerian population has access to clean water?
What was Nigeria's infant mortality rate as of 2010?

context: HIV/AIDS rate in Nigeria is much lower compared to the other African nations such as Kenya or South Africa whose prevalence (percentage) rates are in the double digits. As of 2012[update], the HIV prevalence rate among adults ages 15–49 was just <a0_0>3.1 percent<a0_0/>. As of 2014[update], Life expectancy in Nigeria is <a1_0>52.62 years<a1_0/> on average according to CIA, and <a2_0>just over half<a2_0/> the population have access to potable water and appropriate sanitation; As of 2010[update], the Infant mortality is <a3_0>8.4 deaths per 1000 live births<a3_0/>.
